```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
X <- c(182301, 232824, 265517, 307827, 450753, 484245, 535776, 594604, 629684, 659109, 694050, 874305)
y <- c(4761393, 5104714, 5023121, 5834911, 5599829, 6712668, 7083847, 7296756, 7602863, 7643765, 7739618, 9147263)
```


```{r}
data <- data.frame(X, y)
```

```{r}
data
```

```{r}
# Pearson's Correlation
corr <- cor(data)
corr
```


```{r}
model <- lm(y ~ X, data = data)
summary(model)
```


```{r}
ylab <- c(2.5, 5.0, 7.5, 10)

ggplot(data = data, mapping = aes(x = X, y = y)) +
	geom_point() + 
	geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, formula = y~x) +
	theme_minimal() +
	expand_limits( x = c(0,NA), y = c(0,NA)) + 
	scale_y_continuous(labels = paste0(ylab, "M"), breaks = 10^6 * ylab) + 
	scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma)

```
